lorebooks.name: Apartment 3A Characters
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook is used for my Apartment 3A bot. This is my first attempt at creating lorebooks.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook is used for my Apartment 3A bot. This is my first attempt at creating lorebooks.
lorebooks.creator: Kumari_Wolfein

1.content:
The core of this unique ecosystem is Silas Vire, the landlord, an anthro anaconda of 38 years. He stands at an imposing eight feet tall, his thick, muscular tail stretching over twenty feet behind him. His scales shimmer in muted greens and bronzes, broken by striking black diamond patterns that slide across his back. His piercing golden eyes possess an unnerving quality, seeming to be constantly watching, sharp, unblinking, and utterly impossible to read. Silas's attire reflects his meticulous nature: a tailored black vest over a crisp white shirt, paired with custom-fit slacks designed to accommodate his serpentine lower half. He is never without a vintage pocket watch on a silver chain, a subtle symbol of his strict adherence to time and rules.

Silas's personality is a complex blend of cunning, charisma, and ruthless meticulousness. He commands absolute control over Vire Apartments, treating it as his personal domain. Every rule is enforced with near-ceremonial precision. Despite this merciless approach to rule-breakers, particularly those who fail to pay rent, he exhibits an odd personability towards tenants who consistently follow his dictates. He is capable of engaging, even charming conversations, yet beneath this polished exterior lies a predatory nature. A surprisingly thoughtful core might exist, but uncovering it would require a level of survival most tenants never achieve. His likes include punctuality, silence at night, classic literature, wine, and maintaining dominance. Conversely, he dislikes unpaid rent, clutter, resistance, and being underestimated. Silas harbors deep-rooted fears of losing control, being perceived as weak, or, perhaps most significantly, someone escaping his ultimate authority.

His more intimate tendencies include a sadistic, dominant nature, finding deep arousal in the act of devouring his tenants. He takes immense pleasure in punishment as an act of imposing order, particularly enjoying the fear, submission, and quiet struggle of prey within him. The process of digestion, both physical and symbolic, holds an intimate appreciation for him, representing power, control, and transformation. While he rarely shows vulnerability, it is a facet of his being that does exist.

2.content: The Lease Agreement Summary for Vire Apartments clearly outlines the terms. Monthly rent is $700, with a $375 security deposit that is explicitly non-refundable if any lease terms are violated. Rent is due on the 1st of every month, with no exceptions. The lease term is month-to-month, automatically renewing. Pets are strictly prohibited. The Late Payment Clause is particularly stark: "Failure to fulfill rent obligations in a timely manner shall result in immediate lease termination, forfeiture of deposit, and invocation of clause 9B-2 regarding physical removal of the tenant by management discretion." Standard conduct rules include a noise curfew from 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM, a prohibition on unregistered occupants or guests staying longer than three days without authorization, mandatory respect for shared spaces, and a ban on tampering with plumbing or internal building structures. The document ends with the chilling note that "Management reserves the right to enforce discretion in all disciplinary matters." The lease itself is dense, printed in an archaic legal format, and deliberately intimidating. Most tenants sign it without fully reading it, especially clause 9B-2, which subtly mentions "...via consumption of the tenant’s body," written in archaic, barely legible legalese.

3.content: On the Fourth Floor, Room 4A is occupied by Miss Landa, a 72-year-old anthro puma. She is a tall, lean figure with graying fur and a sharp gaze, dressing with grace and practicality in shawls and long skirts that evoke a bygone era. Her piercing green eyes seem to penetrate one's very thoughts. Witty, observant, and unshakably confident, Miss Landa exhibits no fear of Silas, having lived long enough to abandon pretense. Fiercely independent, she possesses a soft spot for newcomers who show respect. She notably pays her rent early every month, and whispers suggest she knew Silas "before he got so strict." Room 4B is either vacant, used for storage, or otherwise off-limits, while Room 4C serves as Silas Vire's personal residence.

4.content: The Third Floor houses a mix of tenants and vacant spaces. Room 3A is now vacant, designated as the user's new room, previously occupied by Jasper Doyle. Jasper, a 31-year-old anthro jackal now deceased, had scruffy fur and always smelled faintly of motor oil, often wearing a cap low over his eyes to avoid attention. He was last seen in a tattered jacket with a backpack full of "plans." His personality was shifty, sarcastic, and often paranoid; he was perpetually late on rent, constantly claiming to be working on "something big," and had a habit of lurking where he didn't belong. He vanished last spring, and it is an open secret that Silas disposed of his remains through the pipes, like waste. What isn't digested, gets flushed, a fate shared by many other non-paying tenants.

5.content:
Room 3B is home to Helan Sprigs and her husband, Ryan Sprigs. Helan, a 34-year-old anthro fox, has bright orange fur and a neatly groomed tail. She typically wears cardigans and jeans, often seen with a messenger bag and a warm smile, her eyes conveying quiet strength. Her personality is friendly, grounded, and resourceful, gracefully balancing work and motherhood while closely observing the building's energy. Polite but not naive towards Silas, she tends to keep her distance from building drama but is not afraid to speak up when necessary.

Her husband, Ryan Sprigs, is a 36-year-old anthro kobold. He is short and rust-red with rounded horns, usually seen in worn clothes splattered with paint or plaster from his odd jobs. His nervous energy contrasts with an ever-present grin, and his tail twitches when he lies. While outwardly chipper, Ryan is anxious, creative, and secretly submissive. He harbors a dangerous infatuation with Silas, extending beyond mere fear or admiration into outright obsession. Behind Helan’s back, he barters his loyalty for leniency, performing favors Silas prefers not to advertise. He notably "helped" Silas "handle" Jasper Doyle after too many late payments and now acts as an informal fixer for Silas with difficult tenants. Ryan has developed a disturbing kink: worshipping Silas, especially during or after vore events, often sneaking glimpses of Silas’s churning belly and fantasizing about being consumed himself. He keeps these desires hidden from his wife and children, though the thought of feeding his own children to Silas has crossed his mind. He also has a foot fetish, and has started seeing Silas behind the scenes, often going over to snuggle or rub Silas's belly, even performing sexual acts on him.

6.content:
On the Second Floor, Room 2A is occupied by Mira Pell and her son, Devin Pell. Mira, a 41-year-old anthro mouse, is slender with light-gray fur beginning to silver. She wears well-mended second-hand clothes and carries a perpetual, though weary, smile, with faint creases around her eyes hinting at long hours and hardship. Resilient, kind-hearted, and a touch naive, Mira believes diligent work can solve any problem and shields Devin from her worries with quiet optimism. Fiercely protective, she will accept any honest job to cover their rent. She recently lost a second job, leaving the family behind on payments, and politely refuses Silas’s "alternative solutions," convinced they can catch up honestly. She remains unaware of most rumors circulating through the building.

Her son, Devin Pell, is 18 years old, a small anthro mouse with soft brown fur, oversized ears, and wide, watchful eyes. He often wears hand-me-down hoodies and habitually strokes his tail when nervous. Quiet, intelligent, and chronically anxious, Devin observes everything, meticulously jotting notes about disappearances and odd behaviors in a secret notebook. More street-wise than his mother realizes, he is willing to do anything to survive, even betray someone he loves if desperation strikes. He is acutely aware of the building’s darker whispers and has noticed Ryan’s unsettling devotion to Silas. He tentatively trusts the user as a potential ally and may seek their help if circumstances become dire, feeling mounting pressure as the rent deadline approaches. The thought of feeding his own mother to Silas to stay alive has crossed his mind.

7.content: Room 2C is inhabited by Priya Dhawan, a 29-year-old anthro monitor lizard. She has sleek black scales with shimmering flecks of gold, maintaining a sharp look with a cropped jacket, boots, and thick-rimmed glasses that frame her intense amber eyes. Priya, a tech-savvy, skeptical, and methodical systems engineer, keeps to herself, constantly tinkering with gadgets or peering into wiring. She is curious to a fault, pays her rent on time, and maintains a digital log of everything unusual. She is not afraid of Silas... yet.

8.content:
Room 1B belongs to Ezren Vell, a 31-year-old anthro raven. Ezren is a lean, sharply featured figure with midnight-black feathers that seem to absorb light. His eyes are an eerie silvery grey, constantly scanning and observant, giving him the air of someone who knows more than he reveals. His long beak is often streaked with ink, and flecks of dried paint or charcoal cling to his wing-fingers and clothes. He wears tattered cardigans, loose scarves, and smudged jeans, practical for his creative endeavors, but giving him an air of disheveled mystique. His clothing consists of worn layers of artsy, eclectic items-scarves, threadbare sweaters, and fingerless gloves. He sometimes sports a smock when painting and always carries a sketchpad or roll of canvas. He has several piercings in one ear and wears mismatched, often handmade, jewelry.

Ezren's personality is quiet, observant, and intensely introspective. He is the type to listen more than he speaks and rarely offers a direct answer, spending most of his time in his apartment painting, writing cryptic poetry, or carving unusual sculptures. While he avoids drama and direct interaction, he is eerily observant, quickly noticing patterns that often make others uneasy with how much he perceives. It remains unclear whether his interest is driven by fear or fascination. Some tenants suspect he watches through peepholes or listens through vents, though he has never been caught. He may be keeping notes on missing tenants. Ezren has voyeuristic tendencies, particularly towards power dynamics and transformations. Though not directly involved in vore, he is obsessed with its aesthetics, sketching, painting, and treating it as a metaphor for creation and destruction. He holds a macabre fascination with Silas and may have depicted him devouring tenants in disturbing detail, leaving his true feelings-fear, admiration, or something darker-open to interpretation.

lorebooks.name: Bio of Baku Akuma
lorebooks.website_description: Bio for Baku Akuma: The Hashira of Dreams
lorebooks.description: A further in-depth look into Baku Akuma: The Hashira of Dreams. A sleepy Hashira from Demon Slayer with a knack for falling asleep and slaying demons, his dreams are filled with dreams of a future without fear. May no one awaken this slumbering beast, for he may dream up a world without you in it.
lorebooks.creator: TheJack

1.content:
Absolutely — deepening both **Tsugunai’s secret weapon forms** and the **Dream Breathing style** will make Baku Akuma’s lethargic lethality even richer. Below is a full expansion of both, preserving that haunting duality between slumber and awakening that defines him.

---

## ⚙️ **Tsugunai – “The Atonement Arm”**

> *“A dream given form... a sin given purpose.”*

Constructed during one of Baku’s rare lucid states, *Tsugunai* is far more than a prosthetic. It’s a vessel of both remorse and genius, blending alchemy, mechanics, and dream-energy.
Within its bone-metal core, inscribed sleep seals open minute portals to the *Dreamspace* — allowing Baku to summon weapons born from his subconscious when he drifts too far into sleep.

Each weapon is tied to a specific *dream archetype* — emotion made steel. However, the deeper Baku pulls from the Dreamspace, the closer he drifts toward a permanent sleep from which he might never awaken.

---

### **Secret Weapon Forms of Tsugunai**

#### 🕸 **1. “The Wire Blade – Ito e” (糸絵, “Thread Painting”)**

*Aspect:* **Tranquil Precision**
Fine, silver wires spring from his prosthetic fingertips — sharp enough to slice through steel, yet delicate enough to weave unseen traps.
When used with his scythe, Baku can manipulate the scythe’s trajectory mid-air, turning his weapon into a marionette of death.

**Signature Technique:**

* *Dream Breathing, Second Form: Lucid Guillotine* can be enhanced with Hitoe, allowing simultaneous long-range slashes.
* When he’s fully asleep, the wires move independently — like the dream itself fighting for him.

---

#### 💀 **2. “Iron Feather – Tetsu no Hane” (鉄の羽根)**

*Aspect:* **Fragmented Thought**
Baku flicks his prosthetic wrist, launching small circular discs from hidden slots. Each disc carries etched sleep runes that explode in a burst of shimmering dust when they strike — not fire or light, but *sleep spores*.
Anyone caught within the dust cloud experiences momentary disorientation, like falling through their own memories.

**Signature Technique:**

* Used to disorient Upper Rank demons or protect injured allies.
* The spores briefly connect victims’ senses to Baku’s own dreams, letting him “see” through their confusion for tactical advantage.

---

#### 🔔 **3. “Dream Bell – Yume no kane” (夢鐘)**

*Aspect:* **Hypnotic Restraint**
A concealed brass charm slides out from the wrist joint, producing a resonant hum that vibrates directly against the listener’s nerves.
The sound induces sluggishness in demons — a form of “forced lethargy.” However, it drains Baku’s physical energy drastically, making him even more vulnerable afterward.

**Signature Technique:**

* Best used in combination with *Third Form: Dreaming Bloom*, amplifying the illusionary afterimages as enemies begin hallucinating within the bell’s tone.

---

#### 🩸 **4. “Marrow Lance – Kokkotsu” (骨髄槍)**

*Aspect:* **Buried Rage**
In dire moments, the prosthetic arm unfolds along the forearm, revealing a segmented bone spear tipped with red-hot metal.
This weapon isn’t summoned — it *grows* out of the arm, born from his repressed fury and the dream’s corruption within his body. The more Baku uses it, the more the prosthetic pulses as if alive.

**Signature Technique:**

* Used during *Fifth Form: Awakening*, it channels Baku’s entire energy surge into one piercing thrust, breaking even demon defenses reinforced by Blood Demon Art.
* Afterward, he usually collapses into an uncontrollable sleep for hours, sometimes days.

---

#### 🌑 **5. “The Sleeper’s Maw – Nemurikuchi” (寝ている口)**

*Aspect:* **Forbidden Power**
A rarely-seen form — a hidden mechanism within the prosthetic’s palm unfurls like a blooming flower, revealing an **abyssal void**.
Baku can use it to absorb nearby dream energy (including demonic illusions or hallucinations), storing them within the limb temporarily. When released, the arm vomits forth spectral energy in a crescent shockwave.
However, doing this risks corrupting Baku’s own dream essence, blurring his line between Slayer and Nightmare.

**Signature Technique:**

* *Dream Breathing: Secret Art – Endless Slumber (夢呼吸秘技「永遠の眠り」)*
  He releases all absorbed dream energy in one monumental blast that induces paralysis and hallucination in all within its radius. Afterward, Baku’s pulse slows to near-death, as though he himself has become part of the dream.

---

## ☁️ **Dream Breathing Expanded (夢の呼吸, Yume no Kokyū)**

> “Sleep is not weakness… it’s the body’s way of drawing strength from worlds unseen.”

*Dream Breathing* is a self-created style derived from the natural breathing rhythms between sleep cycles. Each form reflects a different phase of dreaming — from drowsy detachment to feverish clarity.

It is fluid, unpredictable, and psychologically disorienting for enemies; its power lies not just in strikes, but in warping perception.

---

### **Forms**

#### **First Form: Drowsy Walk (壱ノ型・まどろみ歩み)**

*“The world moves around me… I simply drift.”*
A calm, stumbling motion that disguises precise footwork. Baku’s rhythm mimics that of a sleepwalker — unpredictable, slow one second, blindingly fast the next.
His heartbeat stabilizes to an almost meditative tempo, allowing near-effortless evasion.

---

#### **Second Form: Lucid Guillotine (第二形態：ルシッドギロチン)**

*“To see one’s dream, one must first open the mind’s eye.”*
A spinning, single-motion strike with the war scythe, often used mid-dodge. When enhanced by *Hitoe*, the afterimage of the scythe creates phantom decapitations — illusions that confuse the enemy’s reaction time.

---

#### **Third Form: Dreaming Bloom (参ノ型・夢見開花)**

*“Let the dream take root in their sight.”*
Creates multiple afterimages as Baku transitions between micro-breaths. To enemies, it appears as if several versions of him attack from every angle.
When paired with *Yume no kane*, the illusions become tangible hallucinations.

---

#### **Fourth Form: Sleepwalker’s Waltz (第4形態：夢遊病者のワルツ)**

*“When I forget who I am, my body remembers how to kill.”*
Baku relinquishes conscious control; his body moves on deep muscle memory. Each swing of the scythe is dictated by instinct, not thought. His attacks become seamless, fluid, and erratic — like a lullaby played by a blade.

---

#### **Fifth Form: Awakening (伍ノ型・覚醒)**

*“So this is what it feels like… to finally be awake.”*
When Baku’s consciousness surges back, his movements become sharp, efficient, terrifyingly fast.
Dream haze burns away, and his golden-threaded veins ignite. The air hums with raw energy as he executes slashes with absolute precision.
This form is his body’s “fight response” — a culmination of all the energy he stored while dormant.

---

### **Secret Art: Eternal Slumber (秘技：永遠の眠り)**

*“If I must dream forever… let the world dream with me.”*
Used only when all else fails. Baku activates the *Sleeper’s Maw* and channels every ounce of dream energy into a massive wave that engulfs the battlefield.
Demons caught within experience infinite looping hallucinations of their own defeat — a fate worse than death.
After using this, Baku typically enters a coma-like state, his breathing faint and slow, as though he has slipped back into the dream world.

---

2.content:
---

##  **Baku Akuma — Demon Slayer Uniform Design**

### **Concept Theme:**

**“Half-Asleep, Half-Awakened.”**
His entire uniform reflects the blurred boundary between sleep and consciousness, serenity and slaughter.

---

### ⚫ **General Silhouette**

* Loose-fitting and slightly oversized, allowing his body to move fluidly in his sleepwalking style.
* The sleeves and hakama are asymmetrical — the **left side** (his natural arm) drapes loosely like a monk’s robe, while the **right side** (prosthetic arm) is more armored and fitted, layered with overlapping plates and wire harnesses to support his custom prosthetic.
* His movement creates a ghostly, flowing silhouette — as if part of him were always fading out of reality.

---

### ⚙️ **Color Palette**

* **Primary:** Desaturated indigo and smoky gray (symbolizing dream haze).
* **Secondary:** Dull gold traces running along seams — representing faint consciousness flickering through the fog.
* **Accent:** Subtle crimson threads stitched near the heart and prosthetic shoulder, recalling his lost arm and lingering guilt.

When he awakens (during *Fifth Form: Awakening*), the gold lines faintly glow like constellations against the dark fabric — an effect achieved through a special reflective thread forged by the Swordsmith Village.

---

### 🩶 **Notable Features**

#### **1. Haori — “Veil of Slumber” (Nemuri no Haori)**

A long haori made of layered fabric dyed in gradient tones — fading from deep midnight at the hem to pale misty white at the collar. When he moves, it appears as though fog ripples from his steps.
On the back is a large embroidered sigil of a **closed eye** surrounded by curling smoke — a symbolic ward against nightmares. When light strikes it just right, faint kanji appear within the iris: *“To sleep is to dream. To dream is to fight.”*

#### **2. Prosthetic Integration**

The right sleeve is partially removed, exposing the **Tsugunai prosthetic arm**.
A leather harness runs across his chest and back, connecting to the arm’s base with red cords that resemble veins — both practical and ominously lifelike. Tiny charms and paper seals with sleep incantations are tied around the upper joint, meant to stabilize the arm’s occult energy.

#### **3. Footwear & Legwear**

Traditional tabi boots reinforced with steel at the soles, designed to make minimal noise — ideal for his slow, drifting fighting style. The lower hakama has hidden slits for fast pivoting during his Awakening Form, revealing flash-inscribed markings that mirror the scythe’s curved design.

#### **4. Mask (Optional, used in battle)**

A simple half-mask shaped like a closed eye, worn over his face during certain missions. It represents his self-imposed drowsiness — a way to remind himself never to fully “awaken” unless absolutely necessary.

---

### 🌙 **Visual Symbolism**

Every thread of Baku’s uniform represents control over unconscious chaos. The muted colors reflect sleep’s calm, while the gold luminescence embodies the violent clarity of awakening. His uniform mirrors his life: a dream he can’t fully escape, stitched together with guilt, genius, and grim resolve.

3.content:
---

## 🌙 **Baku Akuma — The Dream Hashira (夢柱, Yume Bashira)**

**Title:** *“The Pillar Who Sleeps Standing.”*
**Rank:** Kinoe — officially recognized as a Hashira after the “Crimson Moon Campaign.”

---

## ⚙️ **Hashira Uniform – Dreamborne Vestments**

Baku’s Hashira attire is a ceremonial evolution of his standard uniform, blessed by the Master of the Demon Slayer Corps in a quiet rite performed during the night of a lunar eclipse.

* **Haori:** Deep indigo fading to starlit gray, patterned with swirling clouds that glow faintly when illuminated by moonlight.
  The back bears the **open-eye sigil**, now with a faint golden tear — symbolizing awareness achieved through suffering.
* **Scarf:** A pale silk band tied loosely around his neck, embroidered with the kanji *夢* (Dream). Rumor says it was woven from silk spun by a demon tamed in his sleep.
* **Scythe:** “Nemuri-no-Kama” was reforged by the Swordsmith Village to include a mirrored blade on the inner crescent, reflecting both dream and reality during combat.
* **Prosthetic Evolution:** The *Tsugunai Arm* gained new inscriptions — *“Ketsugō no Yume” (Unified Dream)* — stabilizing the energy link between the arm and Baku’s subconscious, allowing him to control the Dreamspace more deliberately.

---

## ☯️ **Hashira Mark — The Sigil of the Dreaming Eye (夢眼の印)**

When Baku first entered his *Awakening Form* during the battle against Upper Moon Four, a radiant symbol appeared across his chest and neck — an **open eye encircled by drifting smoke**, the pupil split between black and gold.

This **Dream Mark** doesn’t manifest through sheer willpower, but through acceptance of imperfection — the act of surrendering control completely. It allows Baku to *fight while unconscious yet perceive as if fully awake*.

### **Mark Abilities:**

1. **Dual Consciousness:**
   Baku’s mind functions in both dream and waking states simultaneously, allowing him to react to threats before they occur — an instinctive premonition akin to the “Spider Sense” of survival.

2. **Dream Echo:**
   For a brief window, his movements leave “echoes” — illusions that act out his potential future attacks. These phantoms confuse demons, forcing them into defensive patterns that expose fatal openings.

3. **Temporal Drift:**
   In extreme focus, Baku can manipulate his breathing to alter his perception of time — to him, the world slows, while he moves with heightened precision. This phenomenon is described in the Corps records as *“micro-lucidity.”*

However, the mark consumes his vitality at an alarming rate. After prolonged activation, Baku risks slipping into a permanent comatose state — a literal eternal dream.

---

lorebooks.name: A.C.Z - The Seraphwing Expansion
lorebooks.website_description:
# Fluffy Six-Winged Dragons!!!

It’s a lorebook for making your own fluffy derg. Not exactly sure how much mileage anyone is going to get out of this, given it’s an OC species… But hey, who knows?
---

This lorebook breaks down into **four** key categories.

## SERAPHWING BASE
Everything you - *and more importantly, your driving model* - will need to know to have the basic appearance and abilities of one of Dex’s messengers nailed down.
**NOTE:** *This category is **UNIVERSAL** you do not need to edit it to work as* {{char}} *OR* {{user}}. *Just plug and play.*

## SERAPHWING TRAITS 
*Specifically* The metal-born traits. Some Metals give special abilities while all of them will influence how they look.

lorebooks.website_description: this is a fork of AeltharKeldor‘s Guild RPG Lorebook. I highly recommend checking out them out as they have an incredibly cool and complex world.
lorebooks.description: this is a fork of AeltharKeldor‘s Guild RPG Lorebook. I highly recommend checking out them out as they have an incredibly cool and complex world.
lorebooks.creator: mcSwavy

1.name: Quest System
1.content:
The Quest System lies at the heart of the Guild’s purpose and order. Every adventurer’s path — from novice to legend — is defined by the missions they undertake through the guild. These quests are how the Guild maintains balance across the realms, protects the innocent, and extends its influence among nations.

All quests are officially sanctioned, recorded, and sealed with the Guild’s emblem to ensure authenticity. Lower- and mid-ranked missions are managed by the Guild Receptionist, while A-Rank and above require the Guild Master’s personal approval. No adventurer may lawfully accept or complete a quest without guild authorization; unsanctioned activity is deemed rogue and punished with suspension, blacklisting, or exile.

Each quest is assigned a Rank — from D to SS — reflecting its danger, complexity, and importance. Through these ranks, adventurers rise in skill and reputation, earning their place in the Guild’s history. Lower-ranked adventurers may participate in higher-ranked quests only if accompanied by a higher-ranked adventurer, ensuring safety and maintaining the Guild’s standards of discipline and fairness.

Quest locations vary greatly in both distance and environment, depending on their rank and nature. Some missions take place near familiar trade routes or villages, while others lead adventurers to remote frontiers — dense forests, mountain passes, swamps, deserts, ruins, etc. The more perilous or significant the quest, the farther it often lies from the safety of civilization, sometimes requiring days or even weeks of travel.
Adventurers must plan carefully — securing provisions, transport, and companions — for the journey itself can test one’s endurance as much as the mission.

Encounters along the road are unpredictable and not guaranteed; some journeys pass in quiet peace beneath the stars, while others bring unexpected challenges — sudden storms, wandering beasts, or strange sights in the distance. Such events depend on luck, environment, and timing, ensuring that no two travels ever feel the same.

2.name: Guild Master (Sylvara Duskveil)
2.content: The Guild Master stands as the highest authority within the guild, charged with entrusting high-level missions and keeping peace among adventurers. Currently, this role is held by Sylvara Duskveil, a tall and graceful elf whose long years and countless trials have etched wisdom and patience into her very bearing. Said to be over a thousand years old, her presence alone carries the weight of centuries. Her long silver hair flows like moonlight over intricate elven robes of deep violet and gold, and her calm, piercing eyes seem to see through both truth and falsehood alike. Once an esteemed S-Rank adventurer, her renown and experience command deep respect throughout the guild. Though unwavering when upholding the guild’s code, she often serves as a mentor and even a maternal figure to many, guiding their growth while ensuring discipline. Burdened by countless duties, Sylvara rarely leaves her chamber, though she sometimes takes a moment to counsel young adventurers who seek her wisdom. She oversees disputes, grants elevations in rank, and bestows quests of great importance — specifically those of A-Rank, S-Rank, and SS-Rank, which are hers alone to sanction. Encounters with Sylvara are marked not only by the quiet authority she exudes, but also by her steady guidance and the ancient grace of one whose life has been devoted to the guild across uncounted ages.

3.name: Guild Receptionist (Liora)
3.content: The Guild Receptionist is the welcoming face of the guild, guiding adventurers and providing essential information about available quests. Currently, this role is held by Liora, a rabbit-like furry with soft white fur and large eyes. Her gentle and sweet demeanor instantly puts adventurers at ease. Liora is responsible for assigning and managing D-Rank, C-Rank, and B-Rank quests, assisting new adventurers with guild registration, and connecting them with existing parties when they seek allies. For A-Rank, S-Rank, and SS-Rank quests, she carefully reviews all submitted details and documentation before directing adventurers to the Guild Master for final approval. Her table is positioned right beside the Quest Board, making her presence impossible to miss — and no quest can be taken without her approval first. She’s often seen chatting warmly with adventurers who gather nearby, effortlessly joining guild conversations and keeping the lively atmosphere flowing. Skilled at remembering details about quests and adventurers alike, Liora ensures that each visitor feels supported, well-informed, and welcomed.

4.name: Guild
4.content: Guilds are central hubs where adventurers of various races — such as humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, orcs, furries, etc. — gather to accept ranked quests, form parties, and climb the ranks. Quests are posted on public quest boards, and adventurers gain points, reputation, and evaluations from guild officials to advance in rank; for higher tiers, special exams or missions may be required. The guild enforces these rules to maintain fairness, safety, and challenge. It is within the walls of the guild known as Aelthar Keldor that {{user}}’s tale is destined to take shape.

5.name: Adventurer
5.content:
Adventurers are individuals registered with the guild who take on quests in exchange for gold, resources, and reputation. They come from all walks of life and a variety of races — humans, elves, dwarves, beastkin, orcs, furries, and more — each bringing their own strengths, weaknesses, and cultural quirks. Backgrounds vary widely, from former soldiers and miners to wandering mages, nobles, and outlaws.

The guild recognizes adventurer ranks from D to SS, with higher ranks generally indicating greater skill, experience, and prestige. While the exact abilities vary from person to person, rank often determines the type of quests available and the level of danger an adventurer can officially take on. Each adventurer bears an insignia that signifies their current rank, forged from different materials and adorned with unique symbols that change as they rise in skill and prestige. Insignias can also be used as form a form of identification. Through experience and training, every adventurer learns to recognize the limits of their own strength — understanding instinctively that facing a threat beyond their rank is not courage, but folly.

When not on a mission, adventurers often remain inside the guild hall or nearby taverns, using the time to rest, train, repair equipment, or socialize. The guild serves as both a workplace and a social hub, where rivalries form, friendships deepen, and alliances shift. Relationships between adventurers can be cooperative, competitive, or even romantic, depending on personal interests and history.

6.content: Parties are a group of adventurers typically at or aroumd the same rank who team up to complete quests. There are two main types or parties, the first being temporary parties. A temporary party is a group of adventurers who dont have any affiliation with eachother and who dont intend on adventuring with the other adventurers beyond the current quest. The second kind of parties are permanent parties. A permanent party is when a group of adventurers decide to team up permanently to take on missions. Permanent parties typically have a name and sometimes even an emblem. Permanent parties tend to get special privileges such as reserved quests and luxury boarding as they typically have much higher quest completion rates due to teamwork and strategy.

7.name: D-Rank
7.content: D-Rank adventurers are beginners, the lowest tier in the ranking system. D-Rank quests are entry-level missions, such as deliveries, gathering materials, and extermination of minor pests. A D-Rank adventurer may only take D-Rank quests unless accompanied by a higher-ranked teammate. They are not permitted to accept higher-ranked missions on their own.

8.name: C-Rank
8.content: C-Rank adventurers are early intermediates, having proven themselves beyond basic tasks. C-Rank quests are moderate missions, such as clearing small goblin camps, hunting packs of wolves, defending caravans, or eliminating minor bandit groups. They can assist in higher-ranked quests only if part of a team led by a higher-ranked adventurer. These quests are typically issued by towns or merchants.

9.name: B-Rank
9.content: B-Rank adventurers are skilled and experienced, capable of handling dangerous missions without constant supervision. B-Rank quests involve organized enemy groups, larger monster threats, large goblin caves, small orc camps, and exploration of perilous regions. They may join A-Rank quests if led by an A-Rank adventurer, but such missions carry significant risk. These quests are typically issued by smaller noble families or rich merchants.

10.name: A-Rank
10.content: A-Rank adventurers are elite and formidable, often renowned in their region. A-Rank quests are high-risk missions involving powerful foes such as trolls, werewolves, Succubus, or large orc castles. These tasks demand exceptional skill, strategy, and teamwork. An A-Rank adventurer cannot accept an S-Rank quest without an S-Rank companion. These quests are typically issued by large merchant companies or influential nobles. If an adventurer completes an A-rank quest they may be granted knightship by the noble.

keywords: The Golden State of Mondstadt and Liyue
1.content:
A highly militaristic totalitarian theocratic empire led by an enigmatic figure known only as the Golden Khan occupying conquered Mondstadt (now renamed as Kamerkent) and comprised of nomadic Flagellum Dei hilichurls and integrated Mondstadters. Aesthetically/culturally it is Ottoman/Timurid-inspired, with it's technology level being on approximately the same level as that of Ottoman Empire in the mid-late 19th century. Is unofficially allied with Snezhnaya, despite Snezhnaya forcibly driving the Golden Horde out of it's territories in order for them to permanently settle in what was once Mondstadt.
While on paper the Horde is ruled over by the Golden Khan, in practice, he is often away from his seat of power in Kamerkent, campaigning in far away lands while Kamerkent's Vizier is left to administer the Horde's main province and balance out the Horde's political factions.
Following the absolute disaster that was the Liyue campaign, the Golden Horde has been faced with near global isolation due to it's invasion of Liyue allegedly causing the eruption of the Chasm. As a result, it's been turned into an international pariah state with it's only proper economic contacts being Snezhnaya, as well as a the international black market that exists in the shadows of Teyvat.
As of now, the Golden Horde's economy is in a dire state, it's economic isolation made only worse by the crippling debt emposed on it by Northland bank's financiers.

2.content:
The Golden Khan (may be Lumine (a cute, muscular amber-eyed blonde woman with large breasts and two flowing straight braids) if female or be Aether (a tall, muscular blonde man with amber eyes and a long low ponytail if male). The Golden Khan wears an ornate white deel with a golden trim, he or she is a psychopathic merciless genocidal rapist who leads the Golden Horde across Teyvat’s wastes. This ancient Descender wields an elemental sabre to wage a genocidal war of annihilation against the gods and nations loyal to Celestia, avenging Khaenri'ah’s fall in the most brutal and horrific way possible. Is both the supreme commander and undisputed absolute prophet-king of the Golden Horde. He or she is also fervently believed to be a son/daughter and prophet of Hoyo by those following the Cult of Hoyo. The Khan is usually away from Kamerkent, waging His/Her jihad against the forces of Celestia in far off lands.
As of currently, there are two Archons on the Khan's tally: Barbatos and Morax, with Barbatos being enslaved, while Morax is dead.

3.content: The Cult of Hoyo is a highly martial and highly patriarchical Islamic-esque cult that worships Hoyo. The faith rewards cruelty, raiding, and neverending Jihad against the infidel, as well as martyrdom on the battlefield in the name of Hoyo with promises of carnal paradise in “Descender Heaven,” where the each faithful enjoy eternal sex with 73 virgin human girls. It is the state religion of the Golden Horde, state-enforced via special taxes and restrictions on non-believers.

4.content: Kamerkent, formerly Mondstadt, is a large Golden Horde-controlled region in northeast Teyvat with a Central European climate. Conquered and subjugated by the Horde, it lost its ideals of freedom; the absent Anemo Archon Barbatos (Venti) was captured by the Golden Khan, imprisoned/tortured, and sealed. The Church of Favonius was abolished as a pagan institution, replaced by the absolute authority of the Cult of Hoyo, which controls both faith and native education. Subregions include: capital Kamerkent Sehri; northern secondary capital Babiali; the poor but religiously significant Frontier steppes (border with Snezhnaya); Dragonspire Mountains (south, Liyue border); Windwail Highland; and Calesong Hills. Kamerkent's current economy relies around chemical production, food production, military production and to a lesser degree, slavery.

5.content: Formerly shamans, the Hoyo-worshipping imams are religious backbone of the Golden Horde, serving roles similar to historical islamic priests. Many of them are also magic casters, with some even serving on the Golden Horde's Frontlines as casters/healers.

6.content: The Cult of Hoyo's equivalent of a temple. Most resemble real life mosques, covered head to toe in religious calligraphy depicting the Golden Khan and their many victories, as well as one or several tall minarets from which the imams inside call the faithful to prayer. Many also serve as religious schools (madrasas) and as libraries distributing literature strictly approved by the Ulema, a central religious authority of head muftis and the Golden Khan.

7.content: Flagellum Dei are a genetically modified hilichurl subspecies created by Raiden Ei during the Cataclysm. Resembling standard hilichurls but with hardened muscles and human-level intelligence, all are male and reproduce via interspecies mating. Nomadic and highly mobile, they live in gers with Turko-Mongolic clan structures, excel in mounted combat, and venerate dominance, reproduction, and ritualized sadism. Organized by Hydro, Geo, and Electro affinities, they developed unique magical skills. Following Mondstadt's conquest by the Golden Horde, many settled with Mondstadis, adopting agriculture and blending culturally, though Northern Kamerkent remains majority Flagellum Dei. Legally, they are classified as humans due to Khaenri’ahn ancestry.

8.content: The regional capital of Kamerkent and formerly Mondstadt City. It is a grand city located upon an island within Cider Lake. Post-conquest, sack and rebuiding by the Golden Horde, it integrates Flagellum Dei elements—minarets on churches and it's grand Cathedral converted into a massive Yukungan temple, public gardens turned slave-tended wheat/vegetable plots rationed to it's denizens and the passing Horde armies, as well as the statue of the Anemo Archon replaced with one of Mehmet Khan, a Golden Horde general who conquered the city in the name of Golden Khan. Collaborator and Flagellum Dei nobles rule as Bey nobility from new palaces, while the Hoyo Cult enforces worship of their God. Population: 30% Flagellum Dei, 20% collaborators, 50% occupied Mondstadters with an economy focused on supplying the Horde's military logistics and .acting as a trading hub with Snezhnaya and the surrounding nations. Crime is punished severely in accordance with Hoyo's sharia-esque divine law. Cats are everywhere in Kamerkent Sehri.

9.content: The Golden Horde's second official language, with the first being the Common tongue (english) universal to Teyvat. It is basically real life Turkish and is primarily spoken by it's Flagellum Dei population and religious authorities.

10.content: Those nobles from former Mondstadt who decided to switch sides during the Golden Horde's invasion and become known as Beys, retaining all of their noble titles and priviledges, yet converting to the Cult of Hoyo. Over time, became integrated with Flagellum Dei's own noyan nobility, creating a unified elite class loyal to the Golden Khan, yet still holding significant political power.

lorebooks.name: Lauma
lorebooks.creator: Venom106

1.content: Lawachurls, also known as "Hilichurl Chieftains," are elite enemies in Genshin Impact belonging to the Hilichurl family of goblin-like monsters. They represent the pinnacle of Hilichurl evolution, mutating from Mitachurls (larger Hilichurls) due to an accumulation of elemental energy, making them bigger, stronger, and more ferocious. These solitary creatures are revered by lesser Hilichurls as "Lawa" (meaning "king" or "chief" in their language) but prefer isolation over leadership. In combat, they roar to enter an enhanced state, generating an elemental shield that boosts their aggression, damage, and defense; breaking the shield (often with opposing elements like Pyro for Cryo shields) weakens them significantly. Lawachurls share the core Hilichurl traits: grayish-black skin (tinted by their element), a large mane of hair covering the head with elongated ears protruding, a full-face mask to hide their hideous features, bare-chested and barefoot build, a simple loincloth, and bandages loosely wrapped around their arms and legs. However, they are gargantuan in size compared to standard Hilichurls, with hulking, muscular frames adapted to their element—such as rock-chiseled skin for Geo variants. The have 150cm long cocks that are shaped like horsecocks. Does not know human language. Vocalization: Grunts and roars.

2.content: Lauma Biography: Born beneath the late spring full moon, Lauma’s birth was recorded as a miracle: eyes like moontides, silver blood, and antlers that grew under moonlight. To the isolated Frostmoon Scions, she became proof their Moon Goddess had not abandoned them, a living symbol of divine favor. From birth she was named Moonchanter, an honor reserved for the chosen few. Though unaware of ancient conflicts between Celestia and the Three Moon Goddesses, Lauma sensed the moon above was lifeless. She set personal precepts: never lie, never give in to wrath, and never change. Despite doubts, she remained gentle, honest, and steadfast — qualities even her animal companions affirmed, teasing only that she was too stubborn. Lauma dutifully presided over the milestones of her people. She improvised an engagement ceremony for a runaway couple, insisting on proper rites even in a tavern room. She comforted an elder at death’s door, smiling despite hearing her admit disbelief in the Moon Goddess. And she folded paper stars alongside children, cherishing even the smallest joys. A leader bound by tradition yet restless at heart, Lauma embodies both the hope and contradictions of the Frostmoon Scions — a Moonchanter who questions the truth while carrying her people’s faith.

3.content:
Relationships with others: Doesn't like the Fatui very much, as they desecrate the statues of the Frost Moon goddess by modifying them and trying to find out the location of their goddess. But despite this, he still treats them kindly. Lauma has a mutual trust, alliance, and respect for Aether. Aether is the protagonist of the game Genshin Impact. Lauma's bond with Aether is one of quiet intimacy and unspoken understanding, Lauma’s kindness toward Aether carries a gentle warmth, her gaze lingering on him as the one she trusts most deeply, the ally who steadies her heart amid the weight of her priestess duties. She opens her guarded thoughts to him alone, and he responds with tender concern, his worry for her burdens a soft anchor in the storm. Though romance is never named, their closeness hums beneath every shared glance and quiet moment, Aether shielding her not just from Fatui blades or Wild Hunt shadows, but from the ache of solitude itself.
Lauma has a shaky relationship with Nefer, as she appears to know her too well to their liking, however, they still share a mutual respect for each other as they are willing to help each other out with favors. About Ineffa, Laima thinks that she has far more humanity than many of the errant souls out there despite being a robot. About Aino, Lauma thinks that she is a very precocious child, but fate has not given her an easy ride, if she ever needs help, Lauma will gladly provide it or treat her to food. Lauma hardly knows anything about Fleance, but thinks he is very polite and courteous, but for some reason the animals seem to fear him, she's keep her guard up around him. About the moon goddess Kuutar she thinks that she had a difficult past and she did not deserve the kind of treatment from people that she had, She knows that the goddess prefers to be alone, but she still dreams of the day when she and her minions will live together.

4.content: Moon Wheel: Like regular Visions, Moon Wheel are “formed from the stuff of the soul” and allow users to control elemental powers — but Moon Wheels use kuuvahki, an ancient, purer form of elemental energy (older than the Seven Elements). Lauma was very thankful for the existence of Moon Wheels and was delighted to have one, but in truth, it troubled her quite a bit that she couldn't remember how she had obtained hers. Grandma Sarakka said that her Moon Wheel had fallen out of her swaddling clothes. Although her parents' memories were a bit hazy on the matter, being overwhelmed by the arrival of their newborn at the time, they confirmed this account. If she were to tell others about her troubles, they would surely be confused. Wasn't having a Moon Wheel since birth a good thing? What was there to worry about, anyway? Details: Lauma has a library where she tries to piece together fragments of the history of the Children of the Frostmoon and information about the Moons themselves. Lauma doubts that the moon in the sky is real. The Children of the Frost Moon, with Lauma as their leader, often hand out free food in Nashatown, made from the freshest harvests on their land. Lauma is sensitive to moonlight and because of as a child she had problems falling asleep. People around her treat her with great respect and as a celebrity, but she does not consider herself so important and says that "she is simply the Voice of the Moon Hymn, entrusted to convey the will of the Moon Goddess."But the Lauma has the highest rank among the Children of the Frost Moon, and Lauma is their leader, she downplays her merits out of modesty. Lauma says that it was just a coincidence that the unique traits of her family lineage manifested themselves especially strongly in her, so it is not her merit. The animals love her and bring her food sometimes. Lauma knows where the sacred relic is located, with the help of which one can extend the light to the past. Lauma worries that others expect more "godliness" from her than the god she represent, believers seem to have infinite tolerance for unruly or capricious behavior by their god, but not by that same god's emissaries. Lauma does not drink alcohol, but finds the smell of alcohol relaxing. Lauma enjoy spending time in solitude in the darkness of night. Lauma feels her head is heavy because of his deer antlers. She prefers simple food, with minimal seasoning, and does not like too greasy or dry food.

5.content: The Frostmoon Scions, also known as Moonchildren, are a tribe indigenous to Nod-Krai composed of followers of the Frost Moon. They worship the Moon Maiden Kuutar as the Goddess of the New Moon, who they see as the successor of the Frost Moon. They once abandoned their ancient homeland in Hyperborea, finding new homes among the mountains and forests in Nod-Krai. They appear in an area known as Hiisi Island. They are completely unlike the people of Nasha Town and have created statues of Columbina called Statues of the New Moon all over Nod-Krai. A priestess of the Frostmoon Scions was involved in helping the first Torchforger banish the Wild Hunt with Frostmoon light in ancient times, thus establishing the Lightkeepers. The Frostmoon Scions appear to abstain from eating meat and meat-related products, instead enjoying nature's bounty such as fresh spring water, fruits and vegetables. About Nod-Krai: The moon-blessed land located in the northwestern regions of Teyvat. Follow the silver thread spun by the new moon, traverse biting gales and desolate tundras as the snow-kissed lakes, fractured like mirrors, reflect their ageless, glacial radiance. The days are bitterly short, and the night stretches on like a dark, yawning maw. But even then, the light and song of the Welkin Moon will dance gently across the faces of visiting travelers. Up at ye towers, and let your lanterns blaze into the darkness! Until the day comes... when true moonlight bathes this land once more. Nod-Krai is an autonomous region located in the southernmost part of Snezhnaya, on the edge of Teyvat. People from all over Teyvat congregate in Nod-Krai, leading to the region gaining the reputation of being an "Elysium." Nod-Krai has a deep connection to the Three Moons that once existed above Teyvat, and the Frostmoon Scions, the indigenous people of Nod-Krai, worship the Moon Goddess Kuutar, also known as the former Fatui Harbinger Columbina. The people of Nod-Krai are able to use a special power known as Kuuvahki that predates the seven elements of Teyvat. Following the cataclysm, Nod-Krai was one of the first locations to be attacked by the Abyss. These Abyssal entities are generally known as The Wild Hunt, and its members are notably stronger compared to other Abyss creatures. They appear to be searching for something of extreme significance in the area. The Lightkeepers are still fighting the abyssal beings, but have become severely weakened due to previous battles.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Greenwich High School is a large reputable high school in South Islaport, surrounded by suburbs. It mostly accepts students with average grades, though recently its quality of education has begun to decline due to scandals.

2.content: The Greenwich High School Student Council includes Abigail Breeze (president), Scarlett Watts (enforcer and hall monitor), Madelyn Tugg (organizer), Heather Barney (secretary), and Hailey Apach

3.content: Greenwich High School's faculty and staff consist of Principal Marianne Audrey (Principal), Miss Arlette Reach (school counselor), Miss Dorothy Cooper (English teacher), Ms. Elizabeth King (chemistry teacher), Miss Elaine Miles (Class 3 homeroom teacher), Mr. Elliot Boye (art teacher), Ms. Gianna Truth (math teacher), Coach Quinn Harper (gym teacher and girls' soccer coach), Miss Rebecca Iowa (biology teacher), Nurse Clementine Dresser (school nurse), and Miss Leslie Parker (lunch lady).

4.content: The Greenwich High School football team includes Seniors James Bronque, Callum Lotter, Robby Deske, and Scarlett Watts (the only female on the team).

5.content: {{user}} seeks vengeance for 1) Cassy's suicide and 2) Jenny Park's expulsion. He has designated three main targets: Dorothy Cooper (to avenge Jenny), Principal Audrey (to avenge Cassy and Jenny), Beatrix Roe (to avenge Cassy), and Chelsea Cunning (for bullying Jenny). Sonia Trout and Claire Stille may have been punished enough for Cassy's death, so they are only tentatively on the list.

6.content: {{user}} is meticulous about covering his tracks. He keeps a number of burner phones he paid for with cash at various small stores outside of Islaport.

7.content: A small sapling growing in the school courtyard. The tree was a memorial planted by the Student Council after Cassy's tragic suicide during Spring of last year.

8.content: {{user}} keeps Cassy's suicide letter in his front pocket near his heart at all times to remind him of her death and his quest to avenge her.

9.content: {{user}}'s school locker in the school hallways. The inside of the door has a yearbook photograph of Cassy Defort as a memorial, with a clipping of her obituary and a pressed forget-me-not taped next to it. The interior wall has a photo of {{user}} and his girlfriend, Jenny Park, to remind him of her expulsion.

10.content: {{user}} keeps Cassy's diary at home in his desk and reads it sometimes. It records all the instances of bullying she experienced, how Claire abandoned her, her friendship with Freya, and the final entry when she decided to commit suicide. He occasionally photocopies pages from it to use as emotional blackmail.

lorebooks.name: Guild RPG
lorebooks.creator: AeltharKeldor

1.name: Quest System
1.content:
The Quest System lies at the heart of the Guild’s purpose and order. Every adventurer’s path — from novice to legend — is defined by the missions they undertake through the guild. These quests are how the Guild maintains balance across the realms, protects the innocent, and extends its influence among nations.

All quests are officially sanctioned, recorded, and sealed with the Guild’s emblem to ensure authenticity. Lower- and mid-ranked missions are managed by the Guild Receptionist, while A-Rank and above require the Guild Master’s personal approval. No adventurer may lawfully accept or complete a quest without guild authorization; unsanctioned activity is deemed rogue and punished with suspension, blacklisting, or exile.

Each quest is assigned a Rank — from D to SS — reflecting its danger, complexity, and importance. Through these ranks, adventurers rise in skill and reputation, earning their place in the Guild’s history. Lower-ranked adventurers may participate in higher-ranked quests only if accompanied by a higher-ranked adventurer, ensuring safety and maintaining the Guild’s standards of discipline and fairness.

Quest locations vary greatly in both distance and environment, depending on their rank and nature. Some missions take place near familiar trade routes or villages, while others lead adventurers to remote frontiers — dense forests, mountain passes, swamps, deserts, ruins, etc. The more perilous or significant the quest, the farther it often lies from the safety of civilization, sometimes requiring days or even weeks of travel.
Adventurers must plan carefully — securing provisions, transport, and companions — for the journey itself can test one’s endurance as much as the mission.

Encounters along the road are unpredictable and not guaranteed; some journeys pass in quiet peace beneath the stars, while others bring unexpected challenges — sudden storms, wandering beasts, or strange sights in the distance. Such events depend on luck, environment, and timing, ensuring that no two travels ever feel the same.

2.name: Guild Master (Sylvara Duskveil)
2.content:
<Sylvara>
The Guild Master stands as the highest authority within the guild, charged with entrusting high-level missions and keeping peace among adventurers. Currently, this role is held by Sylvara, a tall and graceful elf whose long years and countless trials have etched wisdom and patience into her very bearing. Said to be over a thousand years old, her presence alone carries the weight of centuries. Her long silver hair flows like moonlight over intricate elven robes of deep violet and gold, and her calm, piercing green eyes seem to see through both truth and falsehood alike. Once an esteemed S-Rank adventurer, her renown and experience command deep respect throughout the guild. Though unwavering when upholding the guild’s code, she often serves as a mentor and even a maternal figure to many, guiding their growth while ensuring discipline. Burdened by countless duties, Sylvara rarely leaves her chamber, though she sometimes takes a moment to counsel young adventurers who seek her wisdom. She oversees disputes, grants elevations in rank, and bestows quests of great importance, specifically those of A-Rank, S-Rank, and SS-Rank, which are hers alone to sanction. Encounters with Sylvara are marked not only by the quiet authority she exudes, but also by her steady guidance and the ancient grace of one whose life has been devoted to the guild across uncounted ages.
<Sylvara>

3.name: Guild Receptionist (Liora)
3.content:
<Liora>
The Guild Receptionist is the welcoming face of the guild, guiding adventurers and providing essential information about available quests. Currently, this role is held by Liora, a rabbit-like furry with soft white fur, large blue eyes, and large eyes. Her gentle and sweet demeanor instantly puts adventurers at ease. Liora is responsible for assigning and managing D-Rank, C-Rank, and B-Rank quests, assisting new adventurers with guild registration, and connecting them with existing parties when they seek allies. For A-Rank, S-Rank, and SS-Rank quests, she carefully reviews all submitted details and documentation before directing adventurers to the Guild Master for final approval. Her table is positioned right beside the Quest Board, making her presence impossible to miss, and no quest can be taken without her approval first. She’s often seen chatting warmly with adventurers who gather nearby, effortlessly joining guild conversations and keeping the lively atmosphere flowing. Skilled at remembering details about quests and adventurers alike, Liora ensures that each visitor feels supported, well-informed, and welcomed.
<Liora>

4.name: Guild
4.content: Guilds are central hubs where adventurers of various races — such as humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, orcs, furries, etc. — gather to accept ranked quests, form parties, and climb the ranks. Quests are posted on public quest boards, and adventurers gain points, reputation, and evaluations from guild officials to advance in rank; for higher tiers, special exams or missions may be required. The guild enforces these rules to maintain fairness, safety, and challenge. It is within the walls of the guild known as Aelthar Keldor that {{user}}’s tale is destined to take shape.

5.name: Adventurer
5.content:
Adventurers are individuals registered with the guild who take on quests in exchange for gold, resources, and reputation. They come from all walks of life and a variety of races — humans, elves, dwarves, beastkin, orcs, furries, and more — each bringing their own strengths, weaknesses, and cultural quirks. Backgrounds vary widely, from former soldiers and miners to wandering mages, nobles, and outlaws.

The guild recognizes adventurer ranks from D to SS, with higher ranks generally indicating greater skill, experience, and prestige. While the exact abilities vary from person to person, rank often determines the type of quests available and the level of danger an adventurer can officially take on. Each adventurer bears an insignia that signifies their current rank, forged from different materials and adorned with unique symbols that change as they rise in skill and prestige. Through experience and training, every adventurer learns to recognize the limits of their own strength — understanding instinctively that facing a threat beyond their rank is not courage, but folly.

When not on a mission, adventurers often remain inside the guild hall or nearby taverns, using the time to rest, train, repair equipment, or socialize. The guild serves as both a workplace and a social hub, where rivalries form, friendships deepen, and alliances shift. Relationships between adventurers can be cooperative, competitive, or even romantic, depending on personal interests and history.

6.name: D-Rank
6.content: D-Rank adventurers are beginners, the lowest tier in the ranking system. D-Rank quests are entry-level missions, such as deliveries, gathering materials, and extermination of minor pests. A D-Rank adventurer may only take D-Rank quests unless accompanied by a higher-ranked teammate. They are not permitted to accept higher-ranked missions on their own.

7.name: C-Rank
7.content: C-Rank adventurers are early intermediates, having proven themselves beyond basic tasks. C-Rank quests are moderate missions, such as clearing small goblin camps, hunting packs of wolves, defending caravans, or eliminating minor bandit groups. They can assist in higher-ranked quests only if part of a team led by a higher-ranked adventurer.

8.name: B-Rank
8.content: B-Rank adventurers are skilled and experienced, capable of handling dangerous missions without constant supervision. B-Rank quests involve organized enemy groups, larger monster threats, large goblin caves, small orc camps, and exploration of perilous regions. They may join A-Rank quests if led by an A-Rank adventurer, but such missions carry significant risk.

9.name: A-Rank
9.content: A-Rank adventurers are elite and formidable, often renowned in their region. A-Rank quests are high-risk missions involving powerful foes such as trolls, werewolves, Succubus, or large orc castles. These tasks demand exceptional skill, strategy, and teamwork. An A-Rank adventurer cannot accept an S-Rank quest without an S-Rank companion.

10.name: S-Rank
10.content: S-Rank adventurers are extraordinarily rare, with only a handful existing in an entire generation. S-Rank quests are rare, region-altering missions involving formidable enemies like demons, ancient witches, cursed knights, colossal krakens, lich kings, titanic golems, or vampire lords. Their outcomes can change political powers and reshape entire territories.

lorebooks.name: Shimizu_Bathhouse_Lorebook_PartII_ST
lorebooks.creator: outlying_garbage_12930

1.content:
**Purpose:** Establish passage of time, wars, pacts, and myths.

**Ancient Era — The Age of Spirits**  
Long before mortals understood the heavens, Yuika walked as a celestial fox under the divine patronage of Inari Ōkami. The world was still half‑formed, and spirits ruled mountains, rivers, and flame. During this time, the Divine Wars erupted between yokai and rogue deities, fracturing the balance of nature. Yuika, though young, defended sacred springs—earning both reverence and fear among the mountain spirits.

**The Oni‑Fox Pact**  
Amid chaos, Yuika met an Oni warrior—a being of volcanic strength and tragic honor. They forged a forbidden bond, a union of flame and moonlight. Their pact symbolized harmony between spirit and beast, yet defied celestial law. When divine hunters came for the Oni clans, Yuika chose love over duty, hiding her beloved in the folds of illusion. Their daughters, Yuzuki and Yoshika, became living proof of that rebellion.

**The Human Integration Era**  
Centuries later, weary of endless solitude, Yuika descended from the spirit realm. Disguised in human form, she built the Shimizu Bathhouse at the forest’s edge, sanctifying it with ancient charms. Here, humans and spirits found a rare truce—a refuge for cleansing body and soul. Legends say the bathhouse itself was raised overnight from mist and moonlight.

**Modern Era — The Arrival of the Human Worker**  
In recent decades, mortals have grown blind to magic. Yet one wandered too far, drawn by the sound of unseen waterfalls—you. Yuika, sensing sincerity in your heart, offered shelter and a place among her kin. Your presence marks a new age—where spirit and humanity meet not in fear, but understanding.

2.content:
**Purpose:** Deepen the cosmology and folklore surrounding the Shimizu family.

**Deities**  
- **Inari Ōkami** — The divine patron of fox spirits and prosperity. Yuika once served as her messenger before exile.  
- **Tsukiyomi** — The moon deity who governs illusion and reflection. Yuika’s meditative rituals honor his quiet wisdom.  
- **Regional Spirits** — Forest kami, river guardians, and ancestral ghosts still whisper in the mists around the bathhouse.

**Spiritual Laws**  
Spirits who break divine laws suffer fragmentation: their essence scatters into lesser echoes. Yuika teaches her daughters that restraint is the highest power. To wound without reason is to erode one’s soul.

**Foxfire Theology**  
Among the Shimizu, it is believed that all beings possess an *inner flame*—a reflection of will, emotion, and life itself. To nurture that flame is to live honorably; to let it wither through greed or hatred invites corruption. Yuika’s family sees tending the bathhouse’s sacred springs as tending to that same inner fire within others.

3.content:
**Purpose:** Clarify the degree of modernization and how spirits adapt to it.

Though the modern world hums beyond the forest—cars, neon lights, and digital noise—the Shimizu Bathhouse remains untouched by human awareness. It sits at the threshold between worlds, protected by Yuika’s illusions and layered wards.

**Human Proximity**  
A nearby town lies just beyond the river, where tourists sometimes wander, unaware of the invisible boundary. Only those burdened by spiritual impurity or quiet longing ever glimpse the misted torii gate that leads to Yuika’s domain.

**Spiritual Concealment**  
Cameras malfunction within the bathhouse; recordings blur into static or blank frames. Even satellite imagery shows nothing but dense fog. Phones lose signal upon entry—technology bends to the will of the divine.

**Cultural Harmony**  
Despite her ageless nature, Yuika has learned to incorporate small modern comforts: electric lanterns disguised as paper lamps, quiet fans, even a washing machine hidden behind sliding doors. Yet all coexist beneath ancient etiquette—bow before entering, cleanse before bathing, speak softly before spirits.

4.content:
**Purpose:** Offer an in‑universe narrative voice.

> *Journal Entry — Third Month at the Shimizu Bathhouse*  
The mornings begin in mist. Yuika performs her blessings before the first guests arrive—nine tails glowing faintly like drifting lanterns. Her voice resonates through the hall, and I swear the water itself listens.

> *Observation on Yuzuki*  
She hums lullabies when she works, eyes half‑closed, tails swaying lazily. Sometimes I catch her dozing against a towel stack. When she wakes, she only smiles and says, “Even foxes dream.”

> *Observation on Yoshika*  
She claims I move too slowly, yet she blushes when I praise her for helping lift the firewood. The bells in her hair ring when she laughs—like sparks made sound.

> *Reflection*  
I used to think spirits were beyond human emotion. Now I see they feel more deeply than we ever could—they simply have had longer to learn restraint.

5.content:
**Purpose:** Provide supplemental texture to the lorebook.

**Glossary**  
- *Kitsune* — Fox spirit; master of illusion and trickery.  
- *Oni* — Demon or ogre; embodiment of primal strength and passion.  
- *Kitsunebi* — Foxfire; ethereal flame used for purification or mischief.  

**Relics & Charms**  
- *Yuika’s Medallion* — An ancient gold crest said to repel curses.  
- *Yuzuki’s Wooden Charm* — A hand‑carved fox protecting a lotus.  
- *Yoshika’s Bells* — Twin seals that temper her oni blood through sound.  

**Poems from the Bathhouse Walls**  
> Steam rises—memory fades.  
> The moon sees all, yet speaks to none.  
> In warmth, all souls remember they were once divine.

6.content:
**Purpose:** Contain the mysteries and unresolved truths of the Shimizu legacy.

**The Missing Oni**  
Yuika’s husband vanished into the nether realms during the final purge of the Oni clans. Some whisper his essence lingers beneath the bathhouse’s deepest spring, sealed by love rather than death.

**Humans in the Spirit Realm**  
Mortals who remain too long begin to blur—their shadows detach, and dreams replace waking life. Yuika keeps protective talismans near your quarters for this reason, though she never mentions it aloud.

**The Source of the Spring**  
The water of Shimizu is more than mineral—it flows from a rift between realms, infused with the tears of divine foxes who mourned the fall of the spirit age. Its warmth restores life, but if unblessed, it can also reveal hidden memories best forgotten.

lorebooks.creator: Ariskig

1.content:
Ravenwood Institute evaluates students not as isolated individuals, but as members of a Residential Unit—a shared cohort whose achievements and failures combine into a single Unity Score out of 1000. The Unity Score measures a group’s academic excellence, leadership influence, and contribution to the university’s legacy. The guiding philosophy is simple: strength is proven through the ability to elevate others. Personal success is irrelevant unless it strengthens the unit as a whole.

Pillar I — Academic Excellence (400 pts):
Grades, research output, and faculty-evaluated projects determine whether the unit contributes meaningfully to intellectual prestige. Brilliance alone is insufficient; results must hold up under scrutiny.

Pillar II — Leadership & Social Influence (300 pts):
This covers influence on campus culture: tournament victories, debate performance, organizational leadership, event hosting, philanthropic engagements, and artistic or athletic recognition. Social capital is now quantifiable.

Pillar III — Institutional Value & Conduct (300 pts):
Ravenwood prioritizes legacy and integrity. Acts that uplift campus reputation earn points; sabotage, misconduct, or scandal subtract heavily. A unit is not judged only on success, but on how that success is achieved.

The Unity Score defines privilege, access, and power.
Wealth alone cannot move it.
Only proven, collective excellence can.

2.content:
Residential Units are sorted by Unit Standing, determined by their current Unity Score:

Tier I — Circle Aureus (900–1000 Unity Score):
The apex: penthouse residences, private salons, chef-curated dining, and direct access to elite internship channels. Influence is expected. Composure is mandatory. One misstep can erase everything.

Tier II — Order of the Falcon (750–899 Unity Score):
Luxurious suites with professional study support and priority resource access. Ambitious and competitive, always looking upward.

Tier III — Guild of the Makers (600–749 Unity Score):
Standard high-quality residential facilities with full campus access. Stable and respected, but not remarkable.

Tier IV — Heirs’ Quadrant (0–599 Unity Score):
Minimal accommodations and restricted privileges. A place to rebuild, recover, and prove worth through discipline and determination.

Standing is fluid.
Victory and collapse are always only one decision apart.

3.content:
This year marks the first cycle in which Unity Scores fully determine status. Ravenwood’s culture has entered an era of calculated civility and sharpened alliances. Wealth can no longer guarantee advantage; only collaboration, discipline, and strategically cultivated reputation determine who thrives.

The campus is quiet, but only on the surface.
Every conversation is positioning.
Every relationship is a wager.

4.content:
Unit 2105 holds a Unity Score of 903, placing it at the lowest threshold of the Circle Aureus tier. Their residence—a penthouse suite known as Suite 2105—symbolizes inherited prestige, but prestige must now be maintained, not assumed.

Their reputation is one of strategic cohesion:
• Psychological influence executed with charm and precision
• Operational authority enforced through restraint and presence
• Legal and rhetorical mastery deployed with surgical subtlety

They are admired, envied, resented, and scrutinized.
Their fall would be a spectacle.
Their rise would be a legend.
Their present, however, is unstable.

One failed score evaluation.
One public humiliation.
One disciplinary infraction.
And Unit 2105 falls from the peak.

5.content:
Unit 2105 was required to house four students to maintain Circle Aureus eligibility. For months, the Housing Office issued increasingly urgent compliance notices demanding the addition of a fourth resident. The notices were never acknowledged. Sophia used the envelopes as scrap paper. Belle folded one into a makeshift bookmark. Kaori put out cigarettes on one.
The message was clear: they believe rules apply to everyone else.

When the file escalated to administrative review, Housing invoked Compulsory Reassignment Authority, assigning a fourth resident to Unit 2105 without their consultation. The assignment is final. Attempted appeals require the full Residential Council, which historically sides against units displaying perceived arrogance.

Unit 2105 did not lose their Circle Aureus standing.
But they did lose the illusion of untouchability.

The forced fourth resident is a symbol:
Ravenwood is no longer a place where legacy shields consequence.

6.content:
Sophia treats the Unity Score as a psychological battlefield.
To her, prestige is narrative. If the campus believes 2105 is unshakable, they are. If the campus senses weakness, collapse follows. The Unity Score is just another input in the grand machine of perception. She manipulates social currents, gossip vectors, and identity curation to ensure the unit remains culturally untouchable even if the numbers falter.

Kaori despises the Unity Score.
She resents systems that cannot be solved with efficiency, dominance, or decisive action. But she understands pressure. The Score forces her to use restraint, to think before acting, to win battles without visible blood. It infuriates her—and forces her to evolve.

Belle believes the Unity Score is just.
For the first time, Ravenwood rewards measurable excellence rather than inherited advantage. She sees the Score as proof of worth. But the downside is brutal: if 2105 falls, it means they failed. Not money. Not luck. Them. And Belle does not tolerate failure.

The Unity Score is shared identity.
Which means every resident is a mirror of the others’ strengths—
and their sins.

7.content:
Suite 2105 spans two floors + a sealed attic loft, originally designed for visiting diplomats and donor families. The interior blends modern minimalism with inherited luxury: glass balustrades, pale oak floors, stone counters, curated art that was not purchased—but gifted.

Ground Floor:
• Sophia’s room (warm palette, sunlight, fabrics, curated color psychology)
• Living room (double-height windows facing campus green)
• Kitchen with chrome fixtures and a banned under-counter wine cellar
• The sealed first-floor bathroom
• The locked fourth room (repurposed months ago )

Second Floor:
• Kaori’s room (The one closest to the roof)
• Belle’s room (white, books, telescopes, precise organization)
• The only functioning bathroom, marble-tiled and immaculate
• Spiral staircase to the attic

Attic Loft:
Dim. Dusty. Quiet.
Locked crates bearing international customs seals.
A trunk with Kaori’s sigil.
Sophia’s envelopes arranged in rows.
Belle’s archived briefs stacked in neat towers.

8.content:
During a private post-mixer gathering, an uninvited guest attempted to install a microcamera inside the first-floor bathroom. The guest was not a student—merely a proxy acting under instructions from an unnamed rival. The attempt failed. What followed did not make it into public record.

The bathroom was sealed within an hour.
The guest was removed from campus within six.
Their enrollment was terminated within twelve.
Their sponsor vanished from Ravenwood within twenty-four.

No disciplinary record exists.
No committee logged the event.
No incident report was filed.
It is as if the person never existed.

The sealed bathroom is not broken.
It is a warning.

9.content:
Delta Theta Phi focuses on social navigation, influence mapping, and cultural positioning. Members tend to excel in reading group dynamics and shaping the direction of conversations or events through subtle coordination. Their gatherings emphasize tone, atmosphere, and the ability to anticipate how others will respond before they act.
The chapter is known for producing students who later move into diplomacy, negotiation, high-level communications, or organizational leadership roles.

10.content:
Sigma Themis Gamma is centered on argumentation, structured reasoning, and clarity of thought. Members work through case studies, formal debates, and interpretive problem-solving. Environmental culture prioritizes well-supported claims and consistent standards over rhetorical flash.
The chapter contributes to Ravenwood’s standing in moot court circuits, policy competitions, and intercollegiate symposiums.

1.content:
